Description: Pottery lamp. Discus depicts Aphrodite about to strike Eros with sandal; scallop-shell in field. Rounded shoulder. Nozzle defined by transverse groove. Undefined base. Buff clay.
Curator's comments: See 'Lexicon iconographicum mythologiae classicae' ii, I, p.161; 'Lexicon iconographicum mythologiae classicae' ii, 2, p.165, 151.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (2083)
Walters 1914 / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Lamps in the British Museum (1234)
Goodenough 1968 / Jewish symbols in the Graeco-Roman period VIII (fig.69)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
